The density and pressure can now be found by substituting (111.74) back into the original shock equations

$$
\frac{ρ_2}{ρ_1}=\frac{U_1}{U_2}=\frac{γ+1}{γ-1+\frac{2}{M_1^2}} \underset{M_1^2 \rightarrow \infty}{ \longrightarrow } \frac{γ+1}{γ-1}
$$


$$
\begin{aligned}
\frac{r_2}{p_1}=\frac{2 γ M_1^2-(γ-1)}{γ+1} \frac{-}{M_1^2 \rightarrow \infty}>\frac{2 γ}{γ+1} M_1^2
\end{aligned}
$$

```{julia}
using Symbolics
using Latexify
@variables γ::Real M1::Real

ρ = Symbolics.variables(:ρ, 1:2)
p = Symbolics.variables(:p, 1:2)

rules = Dict(
    ρ[2] => (γ + 1) / (γ - 1 + 2 / M1^2) * ρ[1],
    p[2] => (2 * γ * M1^2 - (γ - 1)) / (γ + 1) * p[1]
)

α = p ./ ρ.^γ

ratio = Symbolics.fast_substitute(α[2]/α[1], rules) |> simplify_fractions

r = @acrule (~x * ~y)^(~z) => (~x)^(~z) * (~y)^(~z)
simplify(ratio, RuleSet([r]))
latexify(ratio)
```

$$
\begin{equation}
\frac{\rho_1^{\gamma} \left( 2 - M1^{2} + M1^{2} \gamma \right)^{\gamma} \left( 1 - \gamma + 2 M1^{2} \gamma \right)}{\left( \left( 1 + \gamma \right) \rho_1 \right)^{\gamma} M1^{2 \gamma} \left( 1 + \gamma \right)}
\end{equation}
$$


## Perpendicular Shock

> a. Show Eq. III.90 following Siscoe notes. Follow same procedure as in III.73 to factor the known solution and derive the quadratic coefficients. Write (X-1)(X^2 + A_1 X + A_0)=0 where X = (U2/U1) and solve for A0 and A1 given the coefficients of the cubic. For extra testing of cubic, make sure that X=1 is indeed a valid solution. As another test of your cubic equation (you can do that always during the derivation): Set $A_1 → ∞$ and validate it becomes a quadratic that is identical to III.71 (with M1 defined same as S1).

```{mathematica}
massEq := ρ1 U1 == ρ2 U2
momEq := ρ1 U1^2 + p1 + B1^2/2 == ρ2 U2^2 + p2 + B2^2/2
energyEq := (1/2 ρ1 U1^2 + p1 γ/(γ - 1) + B1^2) U1 == (1/2 ρ2 U2^2 + p2 γ/(γ - 1) + B2^2) U2
FaradayEq := B1 U1 == B2 U2

eqs = {massEq, momEq, energyEq, FaradayEq}
Solve[eqs, {ρ2, p2, U2, B2}]
```
